org.knime.core.eclipseUtil

Class OSGIHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.eclipseUtil.OSGIHelper

  • public final class OSGIHelper
extends Object
    This class contains some methods to access OSGI information that may not be available if the program is not running in a complete OSGI framework.
    Since:
    2.6
    Author:
    Robert Cauble, Pervasive, Thorsten Meinl, University of Konstanz

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OSGIHelper()

    • Method Detail

      • getBundle

        public static org.osgi.framework.Bundle getBundle(Class<?> cls)
        Returns the bundle that contains the given class.
        Parameters:
        cls - a class
        Returns:
        a bundle or null if the bundle cannot be determined

      • getFeature

        public static Optional<org.eclipse.equinox.p2.metadata.IInstallableUnit> getFeature(org.osgi.framework.Bundle bundle)
        Returns the feature in which the given bundle is packaged. If there is more than one feature providing the bundle then one of them (in no particular order) is returned. If the bundle cannot be found in any feature then an empty result is returned.
        Parameters:
        bundle - any bundle
        Returns:
        the installable unit containing the bundle
        Since:
        3.0

      • getApplicationName

        public static String getApplicationName()
        Returns the name of the current Eclipse application.
        Returns:
        the application name

      • getBundle

        public static org.osgi.framework.Bundle getBundle(String symbolicName)
        Returns the resolved bundle with the specified symbolic name that has the highest version. If no resolved bundles are installed that have the specified symbolic name, or if this is not an Eclipse instance then null is returned.
        Parameters:
        symbolicName - the symbolic name of the bundle to be returned.
        Returns:
        the bundle that has the specified symbolic name with the highest version, or null if no bundle is found.
